snippet: While the logistics of getting students back to school are crucial, parents and educators in Gaza face the larger challenge of educating a generation that has survived three wars in six years.
abstract: Parents and educators in Gaza Strip are trying to get students back to school by Sept 14, three weeks later than originally planned; fighting between Israel and Hamas has left at least 34 school buildings damaged beyond use and dozens more in need of major repair; additional 31 schools are still sheltering almost 60,000 residents who lost their homes.

byline.contributor: Fares Akram contributed reporting from Gaza, and Irit Pazner Garshowitz from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: While the logistics of getting students back to school are crucial, parents and educators in Gaza face the larger challenge of educating a generation that has survived three wars in six years.

headline.main: Damaged Buildings and Psyches Challenge Schools in Gaza
headline.print_headline: Damaged Buildings and Psyches Challenge Schools in Gaza

keywords.value: United Nations Relief and Works Agency
